meanings.definition: Thin or lean in appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: The cat was so maigre that you could see its ribs.
meanings.sent2: She preferred a maigre salad with just a light dressing.
meanings.sent3: The maigre tree looked like it needed a good meal!
meanings.sent4: The maigre thread of hope kept her going through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The maigre model strutted down the runway, showcasing her slim figure.

meanings.definition: A dish made without meat or animal products, especially during Lent.
meanings.sent1: During Lent, they enjoyed a delicious maigre stew made with vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant offered a variety of maigre options for those observing Lent.
meanings.sent3: The maigre soup was so good, they didn't even miss the meat!
meanings.sent4: She felt virtuous eating the maigre meal, knowing it was meat-free.
meanings.sent5: The maigre dish was a hit at the potluck, even with the meat lovers.
